title: Positive Endings in Psychotherapy: Bringing Meaningful Closure to Therapeutic Relationships
description: This book examines thoughtfully and comprehensively the steps necessary to terminate open-Anded therapy in a way that is appropriate, satisfying, and beneficial for both client and therapist. It shows clinicians how to determine when therapy should be terminated, who should initiate Andings, how to carry out the last session, and more.
author: Steven Aaron Kramer
